thread.title: UCA romps to 43-7 victory over Houston Baptist
thread.title_full: UCA romps to 43-7 victory over Houston Baptist

author: David McCollum
title: UCA romps to 43-7 victory over Houston Baptist
text:
UCA romps to 43-7 victory over Houston Baptist Posted: October 10, 2015 - 9:57pm By David McCollum LOG CABIN STAFF WRITER 
The University of Central Arkansas Bears used a variety pack of players to power to a 43-7 victory over Houston Baptist (0-3 in the conference), their third straight Southland Conference victory at Dunham Stadium in Houston. 
Leading 6-0 after an 11-yard touchdown pass from Hayden Hildebrand to Dominque Thomas, Conway’s Brandon Cox got the Bears (3-2, 3-0) rolling with a 93-yard punt return for a touchdown. A 3-yard run by Thonmas and a 6-yard pass from Hildebrand to Blake Veasley capped a 71-yard drive in seven plays in the last minutes to put the Bears up, 26-7, at the half. 
In the second half, Hildebrand had touchdown passes of 11 yards to Blake Veasley and 12 yards to Roman Gordon. 
UCA closed the game with its reserves taking 7:00 off the clock to a field goal by Jace Denker. The Bears intercepted three passees. 
UCA had 505 yards in offense with seven ballcarriers, led by Thomas’ 119 yards on 18 carries. 
Hildebrand completed 19 of 24 passes for 274 yards and four touchdowns. Twelve different players caught passes for UCA. 
HBU was held to minus-9 yards rushing with 305 yards in offense. 
UCA had 13 tackles for loss and three interceptions. 
UCA returns home Saturday night against McNeese State.
